response:
Urgent neuroimaging is needed to confirm a right midbrain lesion, define its vascular or structural nature and exclude aneurysm or haemorrhage; subsequent MRI of the neuraxis, CSF studies, neurophysiology and targeted blood tests help confirm or refute demyelinating and other inflammatory aetiologies and assess general medical fitness.

investigations = ["Urgent MRI of brain and brainstem with gadolinium, including dedicated sequences through midbrain and orbits", "MR angiography or CT angiography of circle of Willis and vertebrobasilar circulation", "MRI of cervical and thoracic spine with gadolinium", "Lumbar puncture for cerebrospinal fluid analysis including cell count, protein, glucose, culture, oligoclonal bands and IgG index", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood glucose", "Serum lipid profile", "Serum vitamin B12", "Serum folate", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum ACE level", "Antinuclear antibody", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies", "Serum aquaporin-4 antibody", "Serum MOG antibody", "HIV antigen/antibody test", "Syphilis serology (e.g., VDRL/TPHA)", "ECG", "Visual evoked potentials", "Optical coherence tomography of optic discs and maculae"]
